Unit 102 No.489 Guanghua East Road Building 2

🫓 *GUO KUI 锅盔* (Crispy Meat Flatbread) ‘Pot Helmet’
Marinated Ground Beef/Pork, Chili Powder, Sichuan Peppercorn Powder. Wheat Flour Dough. Black sesame. Grapeseed Oil.
💸 *CN¥7.00 RMB / $0.97 USD*

🍜 *FEI CHANG FEN 肥肠粉* (Fatty Intestine Noodles)
Green Onion, Cilantro, ﻿Seasoning Powder, MSG, Sugar, Pepper, Lard, Peanuts. Wheat Noodles, Bean Sprouts, Pork Stock & Intestine Broth.
💸 *CN¥15.00 RMB / $2.09 USD*

2️⃣ *Yulin Comprehensive Market*
No. 12, Yulin West Street
👨🏻‍🍳 *Mr.Chen 陈师傅*

🍜 *DAN DAN MIAN 担担面* (Dan Dan Noodles)
💸 *CN¥8.00 RMB / $1.11 USD*

3️⃣ *Liu Dayong’s Dan Dan Noodles*
﻿No. 11, Xiheng Street, Zhanbei
👨🏻‍🍳 *Mr. Liu 刘先生*

🍜 *DAN DAN MIAN 担担面* (Dan Dan Noodles)
Chicken Essence, MSG, Peppercorn Powder, Soy Sauce, Pepper Oil Sauce, Oyster Sauce, Salted Turnip, Chickpeas, Green Onion. Pork Stock, Ground Pork Sauce, Peanuts, Bamboo Shoots.
💸 *CN¥13.00 RMB / $1.81 USD*

4️⃣ *Fresh Tofu Supplier*
No. 361 Feihong Road

🥛 *FRESH SILKY TOFU*
Soaked Soybeans Curds. Filtered Soy Liquid. Bittern.

4️⃣ *Mobile Dou Hua Vendor* (Wenshufang)
👨🏻‍🍳 *Mr. Li 李先生*
﻿
🍚 *DOU HUA 豆花* (Silky Tofu with Chili Oil) ‘Tofu Pudding’
Fresh (Silky) Tofu. Chili Oil, Green Onion, Fermented Mustard, Peanuts, MSG, Sichuan Peppercorn & Salt.

4️⃣ *Chengdu Food Street (Jianshe Lane)*
12 Jianshe Lane, Chenghua District, Chengdu City

🧠 *HONG YOU ZHU NAO 红油猪脑* (Pig Brain in Chili Oil) ‘Brain Flower’
Poach. DOUBANJIANG (Fermented Chili Bean Paste) & Sichuan Peppercorn. Garlic/Pickled Pepper. Soy Sauce and a little water or broth to create a sauce consistency. Chopped Onions & Mushrooms. Garlic, ﻿Ginger, Pepper.
👨🏻‍🍳 *Mr Liu 刘先生*
💸 *CN¥20.00 RMB / $2.78 USD*

🍢 *CHUAN CHUAN 串串* (Skewers in Spicy Sauce)
Heated Oil, Fried Sichuan Peppercorns, Dried Chilies for 1-2 minutes, then add ginger, garlic, and DOUBANJIANG (Fermented Chili Bean Paste). Stock, Soy Sauce, Sugar. Sesame Paste, Chili Oil, Soy Dipping Sauce.
👨🏻‍🍳 *Mr Xie 谢先生*
💸 *CN¥1.00 RMB / $0.14 USD*

title: British Mum in CHINA No Longer TRUSTS WESTERN MEDIA After Visit
description:
My British mum just had her first-ever visit to China, and WOW, what an eye-opener! As a British mum, she grew up hearing so many negative stories about China from the Western media, but nothing could have prepared her for the REAL experience of being here.

From the incredible hospitality of the locals to the rich culture and mind-blowing food, everything she’s seen firsthand completely contradicts what she was led to believe. The media paints such a one-sided, often misleading picture of China, and she can’t help but wonder why?

In this vlog, my mum shares her honest thoughts on what surprised her the most, the differences between perception and reality, and why she believes more people should visit China and see it for themselves. This country has so much to offer, and it’s time to challenge the misconceptions!

#china #chinatravel #chinafood

title: Why CHINA was the WORST and the BEST travel of my life
description:
I decided to publish this video in hope to help others not to make the mistakes that I did on my first travel to China. As a Russian passport holder I can have 144 hours or 6 days visa free in some cities of China, so while traveling in Asia I arranged my connecting flights in China to use this visa free opportunity. In this video, I will visit two cities: Shanghai and Beijing.

title: The Most Beautiful Places in China #travel #explore #china
China's MOST Magical Mountain 🏔️ I S2, EP111
description:
We are traveling to my dad's family who live in southern Anhui. First we visited a small village that traditionally holds the Chinese Fish Lantern Festival. A parade with fish lanterns that supposedly bring fortune to someone who touches the head and tail of the fish. 
Then we went to China's most famous mountain: Yellow Mountain which is known by its "sea of clouds". The first attempt didn't go as planned. But the second attempt turned out to be much better.
Join me on this adventure in Southern Anhui 🎬

1:27 Shexian Village 
7:00 Fish Lantern Parade

title: Americans FIRST Chinese New Year in CHINA! 🇨🇳
description:
Shé nián dàjí! 🐍✨ 有中文🇨🇳字幕！点击齿轮⚙️图标。

*Help us reach 100k subscribers* www.youtube.com/@mikeandashley?sub_confirmation=1

We spent Chinese New Year in Guangzhou, and wow—this was an experience we’ll never forget. We had heard mixed things about visiting China during Spring Festival as tourists, so we did what we do best—hit the streets to see for ourselves!

The breathtaking flower markets and the mesmerizing lantern displays lighting up Yuexiu Park made the city feel like a dream. We even tried some unexpected festival snacks (some delicious, some… questionable 😂). As the night went on, we attempted to find the perfect fireworks spot on Shamian Island—spoiler alert: we had no idea we needed reservations. But in true Mike and Ashley fashion, we made the most of it, soaking in the energy, celebrating with locals, and finally catching the sky light up in the most unexpected way.

This was more than just a celebration—it was a reminder of what Chinese New Year is all about: family, tradition, and embracing the moment. We’re so grateful to have experienced this festival firsthand, and we wouldn’t have had it any other way.

Would you visit China during Spring Festival? Let us know in the comments! 🥰

title: China Street Food Heaven!! 14-Hour CHINESE FOOD TOUR in Xi’an, China!!
description:
🇨🇳 Chinese Street Food Tour in Kunming: https://youtu.be/3w6UuOARJxs  
👉 SUBSCRIBE for more: https://www.youtube.com/@UCyEd6QBSgat5kkC6svyjudA 
👕 T-shirts: https://store.migrationology.com/   

XI’AN, CHINA - Today we’re going on an ultimate 14 hour Chinese street food tour in the ancient city of Xi’an, China. If you love to eat, this city in China is a food paradise, from bustling outdoor markets, to the Muslim quarter, and never ending chili oil, we’re about to taste some of the best Chinese food that Xi’an has to offer. 

Xiaonanmen Morning Market (小南门市场) - We’re staring in the morning along the Wall of Xi’an at Xiaonanmen Morning Market. Here you’ll find a plethora of street food and colorful ingredients. We tried the spicy tofu bean curd - 3 RMB ($0.43), the very popular Xi'an pork burger (肘子夹馍) - 10 RMB ($1.43), sticky rice dessert (Zeng Gao (甑糕) - 6 RMB ($0.86), and finally fried vegetable pocket (菜合).

Luzhi Liangfen (老何家卤汁凉粉) - Next up we’re continuing this Chinese street food tour in the Muslim Quarter of Xi’an and trying a very unique dish of bean jelly noodles - Price - 17 RMB ($2.42).

Lao Jiajia Pepper Soup (老贾家胡辣汤) - Although it doesn’t look like much, hulatang (胡辣汤) - hot pepper soup, is extremely flavorful and this is one of the best bowls in Xi’an. 

Liuxinniu Mutton Soup (刘信牛羊肉泡馍) - You can’t visit Xi’an without trying Yangrou Paomo (羊肉泡馍) - a lamb and flatbread soup that’s cooked over a rocket jet flame. This dish truly shows the diversity and cultural crossroads - at the beginning of the Silk Road - that Xi’an is! Price - 28 RMB ($3.99)

Ma'er Youzhi Suantang Dumplings (马二优质酸汤水饺) - Next door you'll find a dumpling jacuzzi where you can enjoy some of the best sour soup dumplings you’ll ever have in your life. Price - 16 RMB ($2.28) 

Liuxiang Noodle Restaurant (柳巷面) - Next up on this Chinese food tour, we headed to this legendary restaurant for hand pulled noodles known as Gungun noodles. This was one of the best bowls of noodles I’ve had in a long time. Price - 22 RMB ($3.14) 

Zhubashi Wangjiao BBQ (竹笆市旺角烤肉) - Finally, another famous food in Xi’an, China is cumin lamb bbq, and as they grill it, they sprinkle it with cumin and chili pepper - it’s some of the best lamb ever. Price - 129 RMB ($18.39) for everything

Xi’an is a Chinese street food paradise, you’ll never run out of amazing food to try!

title: Entering The World’s Largest City You’ve Never Heard Of
description:
MyHeritage has a 30-day free trial right now. Click the link below and use the coupon code 'DREW' for free shipping: https://bit.ly/DrewBinsky_MH

I made it to Chongqing, China!! With a population of 36 million (yes, you read that right – 36 million!), Chongqing is a municipality that feels more like its own country. This city is massive and chaotic with futuristic skyscrapers and bustling street markets. It’s one of the most affordable big cities in the world and there’s something here for everyone to explore.

In this old-school travel vlog, I’ll take you on an adventure through the heart of Chongqing to meet the locals, try some of the spiciest food (hot pot, anyone?), and uncover the wacky culture that makes Chongqing such a unique destination.

What really stood out to me about Chongqing is how it has all the energy and conveniences of a place like Hong Kong, but with almost ZERO tourists. The culture shock here is real, the people are incredibly kind, and the vibe is unlike any other city I’ve experienced in my travels to all 197 countries.

I hope you enjoy the video, and please comment below with your thoughts! :)
